intro: Agaloma marilandica, commonly known as Maryland agaloma, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
